name: 2017_04_humanities_student_major_2019_askwomen
title: 2017-04-humanities-student-major_2019_AskWomen.txt
content_scrubbed:
I went to college a few times.

**First time** right after high school - family would only allow me to apply to a few small, liberal_arts colleges with big endowments for financial aid. My family was well off but very toxic, and didn't want to pay for anything for us kids (they'd restrict food and heat too). At first I didn't get any financial aid because the FAFSA showed my family to be well off, but my mother called and told them some manipulation so suddenly I had about 2/3 of tuition covered in grants by the college. She had me do a lot of work and writing to apply for outside scholarships. There was still a gap in the tuition cost of a total of $15K for the whole 4 years. She forged my signature on student loan documents to borrow that and refused to tell me how much she borrowed (I found out later when I repaid). I also learned years later that my father sent her that $15K so I could graduate without debt, but she kept it for herself and made me repay the loans.

**Second time** - I was 30 and wanted to become a nurse through a community college. I paid out of pocket, from my husband[.] and my savings, on a credit card each semester.

**Third time** - I wanted to advance my nursing degree so I'd have a bachelor[.] rather than just an associate[.]. I was working in a hospital and they gave a few thousand per year in free tuition assistance. That covered about half my tuition, the rest I put on a credit card. I was going to school part_time while working, it took 2 years to get the bachelor[.] degree.
